channel.title: IndyStar.com - Top Stories
channel.description: Top stories from The Indianapolis Star

item.title: Run-off threatens Limberlost Creek
item.description: GENEVA, Ind. -- A draft state report shows farm runoff is polluting Limberlost Creek, a vestige of the ancient Limberlost swamp that inspired author and naturalist Gene Stratton-Porter.

item.title: Indy man slain at motorcycle club
item.description: MARION, Ind. -- Two men were found shot to death in cars outside a motorcycle club, police said. Otis Donald, 23, of Indianapolis and Lamar Cannon, 23, of Marion both suffered single gunshot wounds. Their bodies were found Sunday morning in separate cars parked a short distance from the Black Dragons Motorcycle club, police said.

item.title: One arrested on Northeastside slaying
item.description: A 19-year-old Indianapolis man is in jail this morning in the Dec. 18 shooting death of a man on the Northeastside.

item.title: First egg found in falcon nest
item.description: The peregrine falcons have their first egg in their nest box over Monument Circle. The reddish egg showed up on IndyStar.com's Falcon cam early Saturday. Falcon watchers suspect that the peregrine pair's female, Kathy Q, laid the egg on Friday night.

item.title: Wrong-way crash on I- 69 kills Hamilton Co. woman
item.description: MUNCIE -- A 19-year-old Hamilton County woman was killed in a car crash early this morning while driving the wrong way on Interstate 69, Delaware County Sheriff¹s Deputy Dave Hanauer said.

item.title: Ceremony to kick off Honda construction
item.description: Honda will hold a groundbreaking ceremony for its new Indiana auto manufacturing plant at 11 a.m. today at an 1,700-acre site in Decatur County, near Greensburg.

item.title: Lilly to hire 100 in Japan
item.description: Eli Lilly and Co. will hire an extra 100 sales staff this year in Japan, where sales of its pharmaceuticals grew 7 percent in 2006.

item.title: Woman claims OD death preventable
item.description: PETERSBURG, Ind. -- The fiancée of a southern Indiana man who died in police custody after swallowing several bags of methamphetamine said a quicker reaction by the Pike County Sheriff's Department could have saved his life.

item.title: $182M Powerball ticket sold in Oregon
item.description: One of the tickets sold for Saturday night's Powerball game matched all six numbers drawn, which were: 7, 17, 44, 47, 54 and Powerball 3.

item.title: Police: Fight at teen's party spirals into 2 deaths, 5 injuries
item.description: Police were questioning a 15-year-old boy Sunday night in connection with a deadly, high-speed attack by a rifle-wielding shooter early Sunday that left two people dead and five others injured.
